{{cpp/io/ios_base/title|xalloc}}
{{cpp/io/ios_base/navbar}}
{{ddcl|
static int xalloc();
}}

Returns a unique (program-wide) index value that can be used to access one {{c/core|long}} and one {{c/core|void*}} elements in the private storage of {{tt|std::ios_base}} by calling {{lc|iword()}} and {{lc|pword()}}. The call to {{tt|xalloc}} does not allocate memory.

{{rrev|since=c++11|
This function is thread-safe: concurrent access by multiple threads does not result in a data race.
}}

Effectively increments the next available unique index.

===Return value===
Unique integer for use as pword/iword index.
